title: Dextron-D Kinnow 100G Powder
details: Dextron 20% Is Frequently Used In Both Adults And Children To Restore Blood Dextron Concentrations In The Treatment Of Hypoglycaemia Resulting From Insulin Excess Or From Other Causes
precautions: Only Use Under The Supervision Of Pediatrician
effects: Overdose Of Dextron 20% May Lead To Hyperglycaemia And Glycosuria Leading To Dehydration, Hyperosmolar Coma And Death.

title: Bismol 120ML Susp
details:
This medication is used to treat irritable stomach and intestine conditions. It helps treat most of digestive tract issues. It works by inhibiting the growth of bacteria responsible for stomach issues. This medication is not prescribed to be used

READ MORE
precautions: Before taking the medication inform the doctor about your complete medical history in detail. Inform him about the health issues you have had faced in the past.Read the leaflet carefully and check the list of ingredients specifically. If you find any of the substances you are allergic to in the medicine, then prefer not to take it and ask the doctor to change the medication.Do not keep on using the medication without consulting the doctor because excessive use of this medication is harmful for the stomach muscles and intestinal walls. Do not prescribe the medication to others on your own. People with severe gastric issues should avoid taking the medicine without consulting the doctor. Keep the medicine away from children’s reach.Do not use expired medication.Store it in a cool and dry place. Before taking bismuth subsalicylate, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you are allergic to aspirin, to salicylates (such as salsalate), or to NSAIDs (such as ibuprofen, naproxen, celecoxib); or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. This medication may react with other medications (such as tetracycline antibiotics, chloroquine), preventing them from being fully absorbed by your body. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about how to schedule your medications to prevent this problem. This medication should not be used if you have certain medical conditions. Before using this medicine, consult your doctor or pharmacist if you have bleeding problems (such as hemophilia), bloody/black/tarry stools. It is unknown if this medication passes into breast milk. However, similar drugs pass into breastmilk and may have undesirable effects on a nursing infant. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist of all prescription and nonprescription/herbal products you may use, especially of valproic acid, carbonic anhydrase inhibitors (such as acetazolamide), corticosteroids (such as prednisone), methotrexate.
effects: Likewise, with every other medication, this medicine also has some side effects. Some people might not get any side effects, others might get serious side effects. Following are some of the side effects associated with the use of this medication. In case, any of these side effects appear for more than 2 days, stop using the medication immediately and seek medical assistance. Dark-colored stoolsBrown or tarry colored vomitThe color of the tongue may appear darker than usual for a few daysThe feeling of nausea or vomitingExtreme diarrheaDehydrationUrinary retentionDryness of mouth or extreme thirstIrregular heartbeatDrowsiness or dizzinessAgitation and LethargyLight-headednessNervousness and AnxietyRinging sensation in the earsStomach or intestinal bleedingStomach and abdominal crampingBloody stools.The appearance of rashes and redness on the skinSwelling and itchingShortness of BreathSwelling of face or tongueRinging the ears, or tinnitus, black stool, black tongue, constipation.

title: Lomotil 1MG Tab 20x25 (L)
details:
This medication belongs to the category of medicines known as anti-diarrhea or anticholinergics. The main or active ingredient present in this medicine is diphenoxylate atropine. This substance helps dry up body fluids and slow down the gut movem

READ MORE
precautions: Before taking this medication, inform the doctor about your complete medical history in detail.Read the leaflet carefully to check the list of ingredients. In case you are allergic to any of the ingredients present in the medicine, do not take medicine.People suffering from liver impairment, dehydration, etc., should avoid taking this medication.Pregnant women should also take medicine only on doctor's prescription to avoid any fatal consequences of the medicine on the health of the baby.Breastfeeding mothers should also take medicine if it is required, otherwise do not take medicine at all. This medication can make you dizzy. You shall avoid driving after taking medicine.This medication is considered safe for children over the age of 6 years. People suffering from down syndrome disease may be more prone to the side effects of this medicine. The suspension or liquid form of this medicine contains alcohol. If you are alcohol intolerant or suffering from liver disease, then you must avoid taking this medicine. Store the medicine at room temperatureCheck the expiry date of the product before taking it.Tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of Obstructive jaundice, cirrhosis, Dehydration, Mineral imbalance, Ulcerative colitis, Personal or family history of glaucoma.

title: Libs Cap 1x20 (L)
details: This Medication Is Used To Treat Sudden,Diarrhea(Including TraveleraS Diarrhea).It Works By Slowing Down The Movement Of The Gut. This Decreases The Number Of,Bowel Movements And Makes The Stool Less Watery.
